metadata.name: Programming Languages
metadata.description: Key programming languages with year created, typical current version, and reason for popularity. Update versions as needed.

entries.basedOn: Scripting for the web; standardized as ECMAScript; runtimes like Node.js expanded server-side use
Emphasis on readability and simplicity; strong ecosystem for data science, web, and automation
Write-once-run-anywhere JVM design; strong enterprise tooling and libraries
Designed for systems programming with minimal runtime and direct memory control
Adds higher-level abstractions to C while keeping performance for systems and applications
Designed by Microsoft for the .NET ecosystem; strong tooling and multi-platform use (including Unity)
Simplicity and fast builds with a concurrency model (goroutines) targeted at cloud services
Memory-safety and zero-cost abstractions without a garbage collector, for safe systems programming
Typed superset of JavaScript that compiles to JS to improve reliability in large codebases
Design focused on developer happiness; Rails popularized it for web development
Originally built for web templating and server-side scripting; widespread via CMSes like WordPress
Modern language created by Apple with safety and performance features for Apple platforms
Modern JVM language with concise syntax and official Android platform support
